etymologies: late 18th century. From Chinook Jargon waptu (also written wappatoo), apparently from an unattested Upper Chinookan borrowing of Northern Kalapuyan mam-pdu, with prefix substitution (replacing a Kalapuyan nominal prefix with a Chinookan feminine singular prefix)

definitions: A tuber of the North American arrowhead Sagittaria latifolia or other plant of the genus Sagittaria, traditionally used as food by North American Indians.
